page.title: 01Queen's View Loch Tummel
page.content: Famous viewpoint which was visited by Queen Victoria. On a clear day the Glen Coe hills to the far west can be seen. Car park belongs to the district council and there is a summer only snack bar. Adjoining forestry commission visitor/information centre is also normally open only in the tourist season. In the conifer forest above there is a partly restored old farmsteas and alos a fort. The Queen's View Hotel was previously A;leas House, the mansion of the estate, which has mostly been planted by the forestry commission. Near the lock side there are Birch and Oak woods.
